posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
I started a new thread here:
Here is the first lil' draft. Quite a bugger to lvl, and gets the Rak Shape laaate.
It's got good SR on the end, and unlimited 25 lv  empowered Ice -storm spams. This build is close to what -whizard once made.
It is immune to mind affect via monk 20 (completely undispellable.) which makes it mostly immune to Evards  (and 15/+3 takes care of the damage) and lots of other stuff. Rak shape is immune to all lvl8 and below spells. Raks Dispel can dispel the Bigby IX (DC=12!!!)

Not sure you'll need all the SR, or discipline even, all depending. If one of the items you merge has immune to death, you are safe vs the blessed bolts. That is imperative!

I'll put up a few more, one w/more Druid and one other Monk without SR feats.


Outside the Natural - Druid(5), Shifter(10), Monk(25)
Human, Lawful Neutral
PvM/PvP, Level 40 Theme Build (Highest SR epic shape)

STR: 10
DEX: 8
CON: 14
WIS: 18 (28)
INT: 14
CHA: 8

Hitpoints: 440 Max (336 Average) (Shifts can increase the constitution and add temporary hit points)
Skillpoints: 301
Saving Throws (Fortitude/Will/Reflex): 26/33/20
Rakshasa: 28/35/28

Saving Throw bonuses: +6 vs spells (spellcraft), immunity to mind spells, (+3 vs spells Rakshasa).
BAB: 25/22/19/16/13
Rakshasa (33/28/23)
Ranged AB: 34
AC (naked): 31, Rak: 49
+3 to AC from barkskin
1d4 +1 to strength with bulls strength
SR: 49
Infinite IceStorm: 10d6 cold, 3d6 bludgeoning, SR penetration: 29 + 1d20.
Speed increase: 80%

SKILLS
Animal Empathy 43 (42)
Heal 19(28)
Lore 43(45)
Discipline 43
Hide 43(42)
Move Silently 43(42)
Spellcraft 28(30) + 15 Rak Shape
Tumble 40(39)

LEVELING GUIDE

02: Monk(2):
03: Druid(1): Spell Penetration
04: Monk(3): Wisdom + 1 (19)

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
There's lot of weird stuff going on with shifters.
What I tell you here goes for the Rakshasa, others might have differing mechanics.

Caster lvl for his Dispel Magic, Ice Storm and acid-breath is based on what clas you take on lvl 1. So always pick the class you'll get most levels of at lvl 1. This first build has 25 caster levles form monk, the second has 28 from Druid.

Item merger:
Rakshasa gets the abilities from Armor, items, weapons. 
If you have AC bonus from differing sources, they all become Deflection. So armour +5 and shield +5 would not stack when shifted.

All abilities do work tho, if one gives you regen, one Dodge AC, one immunity to Death, Freedom of movement and immunity to mind affecting they would all go to your shifted form.

The Rakshasa has STR:17 and DEX:20. Spells and items can boost it. It uses your own CON. 

Dragonshape overlaps all 3 physical. Monk bonus to AC and WIS AC works when shifted.

Maximise and other Metamagic works on your innate spells. So the Rakshasa ICestorm can be Cast Quickened (w/autoqucken only) AND Maximised. That means one Maximised Icestorm every 3rd second. If you have permahaste, Autoquicken does nothing.

OH, Rakshasa and Dragonshape has True Seeing, always! That is good!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Grimnir wrote: Caster lvl for his Dispel Magic, Ice Storm and acid-breath is based on what clas you take on lvl 1. So always pick the class you'll get most levels of at lvl 1. This first build has 25 caster levles form monk, the second has 28 from Druid.
Important point!
Be careful what class to pick at level 1: Plan ahead and take your majority class at lvl 1!

Grimnir wrote: Item merger:
Rakshasa gets the abilities from Armor, items, weapons. 
If you have AC bonus from differing sources, they all become Deflection. So armour +5 and shield +5 would not stack when shifted.

All abilities do work tho, if one gives you regen, one Dodge AC, one immunity to Death, Freedom of movement and immunity to mind affecting they would all go to your shifted form.

The Rakshasa has STR:17 and DEX:20. Spells and items can boost it. It uses your own CON. 

Dragonshape overlaps all 3 physical. Monk bonus to AC and WIS AC works when shifted.

Maximise and other Metamagic works on your innate spells. So the Rakshasa ICestorm can be Cast Quickened (w/autoqucken only) AND Maximised. That means one Maximised Icestorm every 3rd second. If you have permahaste, Autoquicken does nothing.

OH, Rakshasa and Dragonshape has True Seeing, always! That is good!
Very handy info on the Rakshasa. I don't play shifters a lot, so this serves as a fine reminder.

I have one question though. I can understand that when you take auto-quicken, it applies to all casting. But when you want to empower or maximize, will you not need to have the meta magical version of the spell remembered in your spell-book and then quick slot it from there? And if that is the case, how can that monk build with only 5 druid levels empower Ice storm?

Edit: oh, and by the way Grimnir - I love that signature!

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
Wiz/Sorc has Ice Storm at level 4 so Autoquicken 2 is enough with that as primary class.

It's been a long time, Mick, good to see you. You raise a valid point and I think you're right. You can't cast empowered Ice Storms in the monk build, just regular ones.
I will just have test it again. It's been a long time. Thanks.

Sent fra min SM-G920F via Tapatalk

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
I just tested it. You can't empower in the first build. Change the feat for something
else. I see Toughness at least.

Sent fra min SM-G950F via Tapatalk

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
The Rakshasa shape in the Druid build will have a 47 AC right off the build. 12 of which are dodge.

With your spells and item merger the AC will become quite high. Let's say a +5 environ with possibility to max DEX and WIS. You can max WIS by yourelf btw.

47+10 ImpExp + 6DEX + 6 WIS + 5 Dodge(you will then be 3 from cap) + 5 deflection + 5 nat AC (barkskin) = 84. Not foolproof, but very good.

Maximised Ice Storm will do 66 Ice + 18 Blunt damage for a total of 84 dmg every third sec. That's no-save dmg right there.

Rakshasa also has DR 15/+5, but you will need Death immunity (for blessed bolts) and in the Druid build, and item with mind immunity would go a long way!

You wanna go mob cleaner or melee rampage you go Dragonmode.
DR 40/+6, high AC, possible 60 STR Dragon with a nice Area Breath and +6 claws. IKD machine. You can do that too, when not in mage-fighting mode. If you haven't tried Dragon, just do it!

Do you mean the first built with 25 monk levels cannot have empowered ice storm?
Is that not a good built compared to the other two built with 2 monk level?

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
phmah2408 wrote:Do you mean the first built with 25 monk levels cannot have empowered ice storm?
Is that not a good built compared to the other two built with 2 monk level?
It has other strengths. Like 49 SR, Mind immunity, and other Monk goodies. Ice Storm still does 10d6 cold +3d6 Bludgeoning. Little better AC and faster movement.

posts.author: Kalistez
posts.content:
Just a quick question.

Having never played a Shifter before, I was wondering why you maxed Hide and MS ?

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
Kalistez wrote: Just a quick question.

Having never played a Shifter before, I was wondering why you maxed Hide and MS ?
There's lots of skills that are unusable in Shifted forms,like trap setting. And with Monk speed you can run and hide, so it's possible for you to recover.
Death Slaad shape has regen 5, f.ex.if you need to hide in a corner and heal. Death Slaad also has a ranged touch attack doing 5d4 damage. 
It's also nice to give you the head start in combat.

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
phmah2408 wrote:also the first monk base shifter get the outsider shape only at 39? arghhhh that is too late
You need monk every feat level for ISR. I think it should be possible to push it down some levels and still keep all the sr, let me check it. I made it for a good end result, which it is. The other gets it earlier and has a bit more versatility. The second build is also way easier to lvl up. At least until you get good shifts.

Grimnr, how does quicken spell works? Don't quite understand it. I see you took automatic quicken spell 1,2,3. How does it works? thanks

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
phmah2408 wrote:Grimnr, how does quicken spell works? Don't quite understand it. I see you took automatic quicken spell 1,2,3. How does it works? thanks
A spell can be cast twice a round. It means you fire 1 Ice Storm every 3 secs instead og every 6.

If you have an iten that grants you permanent haste when shifted, then switch those feats out.

Grimnr, how does quicken spell works? Don't quite understand it. I see you took automatic quicken spell 1,2,3. How does it works? thanks
A spell can be cast twice a round. It means you fire 1 Ice Storm every 3 secs instead og every 6.

If you have an iten that grants you permanent haste when shifted, then switch those feats out.

Sent fra min SM-G950F via Tapatalk
thanks! It's hard to get haste in my server. Unless I have lots of Quest tokens to get one. maybe one day I will loot it. But thank you for your value feedback! it clears my mind on those. Also I realized you dont have empowered spell. Is max. spell better than empowered ice storm?

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
You can't use both. Yeah, it gives a higher value more often than not.

Average damage on 1d6 is 3.5. Empowered its 3.5 x 1.5 = 5.25. Not to big a difference from maxed, but it means about 10hp pr Ice Storm.

Sent fra min SM-G950F via Tapatalk

posts.author: Orlouge
posts.content:
Noob here, just a few questions:
1) Why all that SR in a Rak build? Seems like an overkill considering Rak lvl 8 spell immunity. 
2) Reading Max Kane druid's guide (on the comments) it seems Rak can reach crazy AC in high magic env. (which seems weird to me since bonus AC from items is merged as deflection). Could you kindly enlighten me on how to reach the highest AC possible on a Rak?

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
1) It's for lvl 9 spells. Even a caster with 40 caster levels and all penetration feats will miss 10% of his spells.
2) I did some calculations on AC earlier, for the Monk build.
47+
10 ImpExp + 
6DEX + 
6 WIS + 
5 Dodge(you will then be 3 from cap) + 
5 deflection + 
5 nat AC (barkskin) = 
84. Not foolproof, but very good. Maybe you can get 3 more dodge somewhere, you're 3 from cap. A high magic environment won't help you much, actually I think a build like this will benefit more ina mid-magic environment. 

84 is enough so that a combat cleric won't hit you all that much. A caster cleric never. A Weapon master with, say 54 AB, + 6 STR and +5 weapon? Not much at all. So the AC is quite good.

posts.author: Orlouge
posts.content:
Grimnir wrote: 1) It's for lvl 9 spells. Even a caster with 40 caster levels and all penetration feats will miss 10% of his spells.
2) I did some calculations on AC earlier, for the Monk build.
47+
10 ImpExp + 
6DEX + 
6 WIS + 
5 Dodge(you will then be 3 from cap) + 
5 deflection + 
5 nat AC (barkskin) = 
84. Not foolproof, but very good. Maybe you can get 3 more dodge somewhere, you're 3 from cap. A high magic environment won't help you much, actually I think a build like this will benefit more ina mid-magic environment. 

84 is enough so that a combat cleric won't hit you all that much. A caster cleric never. A Weapon master with, say 54 AB, + 6 STR and +5 weapon? Not much at all. So the AC is quite good.
Where do you get the 5 dodge and deflection from? Items? Also, how you get the base 47 AC? Afaik Rak has 27 base plus 12 polymorph dodge. Sorry for being so noob.

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
Orlouge wrote:
Grimnir wrote: 1) It's for lvl 9 spells. Even a caster with 40 caster levels and all penetration feats will miss 10% of his spells.
2) I did some calculations on AC earlier, for the Monk build.

5 nat AC (barkskin) = 
84. Not foolproof, but very good. Maybe you can get 3 more dodge somewhere, you're 3 from cap. A high magic environment won't help you much, actually I think a build like this will benefit more ina mid-magic environment. 

84 is enough so that a combat cleric won't hit you all that much. A caster cleric never. A Weapon master with, say 54 AB, + 6 STR and +5 weapon? Not much at all. So the AC is quite good.
Where do you get the 5 dodge and deflection from? Items? Also, how you get the base 47 AC? Afaik Rak has 27 base plus 12 polymorph dodge. Sorry for being so noob.
It's actually the Druid build that starts on 47, not the monk.

I guessed a +5 environment. Where you can find a +5 item, and a dodge item.

It has +12 dodge AC from Rak shape. The rest of the AC comes from tumble, Monk levels and Wisdom to AC thanks to monk class and unarmored Rak.

posts.author: phmah2408
posts.content: Wondering what happen if my target is spell immune and what can this built do to take it down?

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
phmah2408 wrote:Wondering what happen if my target is spell immune and what can this built do to take it down?
Use the acid breath. Doesn't check against SR. Or another Shape if it's not a player. Like the Slaad. You got your defenses still, and your speed. The Slaad shape ain't too bad. And possibly Wildshapes.

posts.author: TomRotfl
posts.content:
Hi Guys! i am having an issue with the maximise spell feats. In my build (15 druid 19 shifter 6 monk), even if i get the maximise spells feat and put some maximised ice storms into slots, when i turn in rakshasa it won't work.

It appears the maximised ice storm icon with infinite usages, but when i try to use it game says: No uses or preparations left for that spell.

Any idea?

posts.author: TomRotfl
posts.content: Found the issue. If you guys run NWN:EE that trick have been fixed and doesn't work anymore. Still working on old nwn. So sad.

posts.author: TomRotfl
posts.content:

You can, but not maximised. Just standard spell. I tried same build on both versions. Old can, new cannot.
